Monster¶

class Monster : public Character¶

Represents an enemy character (Monster).

Inherits from Character and includes AI logic for battle actions.

Public Functions

Monster(std::string name, int hp, int attackPower)¶

Constructor for Monster.

パラメータ:

  • name -- The name of the monster.

  • hp -- The initial HP.

  • attackPower -- The base attack power.

virtual void attack(Character &target) override¶

Attacks a target character.

パラメータ:

target -- The character to attack.

void performAction(Character &target)¶

Performs an action during the monster's turn.

Decides whether to attack or perform other actions based on AI logic.

パラメータ:

target -- The target of the action (usually the Hero).

Source Code

Header (include/models/Monster.h):

 1#ifndef MONSTER_H
 2#define MONSTER_H
 3
 4#include "models/Character.h"
 5
 6/**
 7 * @brief Represents an enemy character (Monster).
 8 *
 9 * Inherits from Character and includes AI logic for battle actions.
10 */
11class Monster : public Character {
12public:
13    /**
14     * @brief Constructor for Monster.
15     *
16     * @param name The name of the monster.
17     * @param hp The initial HP.
18     * @param attackPower The base attack power.
19     */
20    Monster(std::string name, int hp, int attackPower);
21
22    /**
23     * @brief Attacks a target character.
24     *
25     * @param target The character to attack.
26     */
27    void attack(Character& target) override;
28
29    /**
30     * @brief Performs an action during the monster's turn.
31     *
32     * Decides whether to attack or perform other actions based on AI logic.
33     *
34     * @param target The target of the action (usually the Hero).
35     */
36    void performAction(Character& target);
37};
38
39#endif // MONSTER_H

Implementation (src/models/Monster.cpp):

 1#include "models/Monster.h"
 2#include "utils/Dice.h"
 3#include <iostream>
 4
 5Monster::Monster(std::string name, int hp, int attackPower)
 6    : Character(name, hp, attackPower) {}
 7
 8void Monster::attack(Character& target) {
 9    int damage = Dice::get(attackPower - 2, attackPower + 2);
10    std::cout << name << " attacks " << target.getName() << "!" << std::endl;
11    target.takeDamage(damage);
12}
13
14void Monster::performAction(Character& target) {
15    // Simple AI: 20% chance to do a strong attack (if we had skills), otherwise normal attack
16    // For now, just attack
17    attack(target);
18}
